(Public Dragoman in Venice, employed by the Venetian Cinque Savi alla Mercantia (the Board of Trade) to assist Ottoman and Safavid merchants in their business dealings in Venice, to translate chancery documents from Ottoman Turkish, and to interpret during official visits of Ottoman and Safavid dignitaries)
(Found in eighteenth century (e.g. Francesco Brutti's petition, 1762, see Lucchetta 1993: 216); evidently denotes a position above and beyond the quota of dragomanni ordinarii)
